topic.title: SDK Legacy-Authentication Overview
topic.shortdesc: Pre-RBAC versions of the SDK can authenticate against Couchbase Server 5.0 and beyond.

section.title: Authenticating with Legacy SDK Versions
section.p: All pre-RBAC versions of the SDK can continue to be used with Couchbase Server 5.0 and beyond: the pre-RBAC authentication procedure need not change. However, note the following:

ul.li: When passed, the value formerly interpreted as a bucket-name is now interpreted as a username. The username must correspond to a user defined on the cluster that is being accessed.
When passed, the value formerly interpreted as a bucket-password is interpreted as the password of the defined user.

section.p: For the bucket to be accessed successfully, the defined user must have been assigned appropriate roles. See RBAC User Management for information on user-management.
See Upgrading to RBAC for information on server-upgrade to 5.0, and how this affects access to legacy buckets.
